title: [K-12] Remote Sensing Image Caption Generation: Design and Evaluation of Self-Learning-Based Language Generation Solutions

context.prior_knowledge: Basic machine learning concepts, experience with remote sensing data processing, understanding of deep learning model architectures, foundational English grammar and vocabulary knowledge, comprehension of text generation model evaluation methodologies
context.additional_context: In a simulated environment with limited labeled data, learners practice high-quality natural language caption generation techniques and explore methods to improve model performance through self-learning algorithms. They utilize multilingual evaluation metrics (ROUGE, BLEU, METEOR, etc.) for assessing the expressiveness and accuracy of generated captions, along with grammar error analysis tools.

learning_goals: Apply self-supervised learning techniques (SFRC) to a limited remote sensing image dataset to improve the accuracy of a natural language caption generation model by â‰¥20% and enhance lexical diversity and grammatical accuracy of generated text
Design feature extractors using BYOL-based self-supervised learning and demonstrate the ability to analyze text-image associations, evaluating semantic consistency of captions

Implement a self-distillation process between teacher-student models in a simulated environment and validate grammatical/semantic consistency and expressiveness of generated captions using multilingual evaluation metrics
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
